Description: Ithyphallic figure of Osiris composed of corn wrapped in bandages with a gilded and modelled beeswax face.
Curator's comments: Published: M. C. Centrone, Egyptian Corn Mummies: A Class of Religious Artefacts Catalogued and Systematically Analysed (Saarbruecken, VDM 2009), no. 80. Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, Japan 1999-2000, [49] Sacred Food, Barcelona 2001, pp. 200-201 [83]
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001 30 Jun-30 Sep, Barcelona, Sacred Food
